items.item: For each experiment, provide precise details of study design including:
items.details:
- Primary research question and secondary questions
- Key dependent and independent variables
- Study timeline and duration
- Experimental unit (individual animal, cage, litter)

items.item: Explain how sample size was determined
items.details:
- Power analysis calculations
- Effect size estimates
- Alpha and beta levels
- Reference to pilot data or literature

items.item: Provide details of animals used, including:
items.details:
- Species, strain, substrain
- Sex and age/weight
- Source and vendor
- Health/microbiological status

- Housing system and environment
- Diet and feeding schedule
- Environmental enrichment
- Social housing arrangements

items.item: For each experimental group describe procedures in detail:
items.details:
- What, how, when, where procedures were carried out
- Dosing regimens and administration routes
- Anesthesia and analgesic protocols
- Method of euthanasia

items.item: Describe experimental outcomes and how they were assessed
items.details:
- Primary and secondary outcome measures
- Assessment methods and timing
- Who assessed outcomes and whether blinded
- Quality control measures

items.item: Describe statistical methods for each analysis
items.details:
- Statistical tests used and rationale
- Unit of analysis and experimental unit
- How data were handled (transformations, outliers)
- Multiple comparisons corrections

items.item: Report exact P values and effect sizes where possible
items.details:
- Exact P values (not just <0.05)
- Confidence intervals
- Effect sizes with interpretation
- Number of animals in each analysis

items.item: Report study timeline and actual sample sizes
items.details:
- When study was performed
- Number of animals in each group at each time point
- Reasons for attrition or exclusion
- Flow diagram if complex design

items.item: Present results for each analysis with appropriate statistics
items.details:
- Raw data or summary statistics
- Variability measures (SD, SEM, CI)
- Statistical test results
- Biological as well as statistical significance
